metadata.Description: The process of capturing carbon dioxide emissions and converting them into useful products.

level 1.Description: Carbon capture and utilization implements carbon reduction strategies to mitigate the impact of greenhouse gas emissions on the environment.
Carbon capture and utilization funds research and development initiatives to explore innovative technologies and processes for capturing and utilizing carbon.
Carbon capture and utilization partners with industrial sectors to collaborate on implementing carbon capture and utilization technologies and practices.
Carbon capture and utilization supports climate change mitigation efforts by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and promoting sustainable practices.
Carbon capture and utilization administers carbon offset programs to incentivize and support projects that reduce or offset carbon emissions.

level 2.Subject: carbon offset programs
level 2.Description: Carbon offset programs implement sustainable development goals to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote sustainable practices.

level 2.Subject: carbon offset programs
level 2.Description: Carbon offset programs focus on emission reduction strategies to mitigate the impact of greenhouse gas emissions on climate change.

level 2.Subject: carbon offset programs
level 2.Description: Carbon offset programs play a crucial role in climate change mitigation efforts by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and promoting sustainable practices.

level 2.Subject: carbon offset programs
level 2.Description: Carbon offset programs set targets for achieving net-zero emissions by supporting projects that reduce and offset greenhouse gas emissions.

level 2.Subject: carbon offset programs
level 2.Description: Carbon offset programs address climate change by promoting sustainable practices and supporting projects that reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
